text: I believe I am special and unique and should only associate with other special or high-status people.
I require excessive admiration and validation from others to feel good about myself.
I have a grandiose sense of self-importance and believe I'm better than others.
I feel like I have main-character energy and the world revolves around me.
I lack empathy and have difficulty understanding or caring about others' feelings.
I exploit others to achieve my own goals without feeling guilty.
I feel envious of others or believe others are envious of me.
I show arrogant or haughty behaviors and attitudes.
I have fantasies of unlimited success, power, brilliance, beauty, or ideal love.
I feel entitled to special treatment and expect others to comply with my expectations.
I can appreciate others' achievements and feel genuinely happy for their success.
I treat others with respect and consideration, valuing their feelings and perspectives.
I have a realistic and balanced view of my strengths and weaknesses.
I can accept criticism and feedback without feeling personally attacked.
I feel comfortable with others receiving attention and don't need to be the center of attention.
I feel like my confidence and self-importance are turned up too high.
I struggle to maintain healthy relationships because I prioritize my own needs over others.
I feel like I deserve special privileges and shouldn't have to follow the same rules as others.
I have difficulty accepting that others might be more talented, successful, or attractive than me.
I can maintain healthy self-esteem without needing constant external validation.
